revised_title: Advances in Electrometer Design and Measurement Techniques
tldr: This article discusses the development of electrometer design and measurement techniques, focusing on the heterostatic method and the calculation of the effective area of the attracted disk. The authors present numerical results and curves for their electrometer and provide a more accurate formula for the effective area when the disk is in the plane of the guard-ring. They also investigate the error in the ordinary assumption of the effective area when the disk and guard-ring are not in the same plane.
